body.p:
Bowling Green Ky
August 17. 1861
Govr Magoffin
Dr Sir

Mr J K Price Mentioned in R Rodes letter (on the other half of this sheet) is a poor man ^yet an honest man^ with some small children, having lost his wife & having had a great deal of sickness in his Familly, to pay the fine & costs mentioned, would harras & oppress him seriously and he is now trying by the dint of hard labor & Industry to sustain himself & children -- If you can consistantly with the duties of clemency of your office relieve him, you will confer lasting gratitude upon of Price & will be acknowledged by your humble servant.
P. S. At the Instance of Mr J K Price, he requests that you ^respond^ to me or to him to my case.

Bowling Green Ky
Augst 17 1861
His Excellency

Gov Magoffin: As one of the Attos for Jos K Price and at his request I write you then to ask You to remit or respite his fine of $60 & cost rendered agst him at the Augst term of the Warren Eq & Cml_Co for keeping a tippling house
Mr J K Price is a poor man with a wife & several children in his family -- He says the two witnesses agst him were both Brothers & violent Enemies of his by the name of Smith --
In these days of adversity if yr Excellency can remit the fine or respite it, you will render Mr Price a very happy man & place him under great obligation to you in person --
